Title: 41806 - # Forgotten Ways to Remove Allergens In Your Home
Direction: 500 words. List 3-6 ways parents can rid their homes of allergens like dust, pollen, and pet dander. Explain that pets can bring in pollen when they go outside, so it's important to keep your home clean to make breathing easier. To incorporate the client link, list HVAC maintenance in one of the subheads as a way to reduce dust. Examples of this include covering your mattress and pillows with dust mite covers for better sleeping, wiping down pets when they come inside, and using proper dusting techniques. Your audience is moms who want their kids to be allergy-free, but not live in a bubble. Please link to this blog post as your target URL, not the client’s homepage: http://boundshvac.com/articles/6-preventive-steps-healthier-indoor-air-quality

Title: 41809 -  # Reasons to Get Your Heating Checked in August
Direction: 500 words. List 3-6 reasons why homeowners would want to have their HVAC equipment (specifically their heating) checked in August, despite the fact it's 90 degrees out. Reasons can include saving money when there's low demand, staying comfortable in the winter by making fixes now, and routine maintenance improving the longevity of your device. The client link can go in any of these sections when talking about having your local HVAC company conducting an inspection or repair. Your target audience is moms who like saving money and preparing for back to school season. Please link to this blog post as your target URL, not the client’s homepage: http://airconditioningsoutheast.com/blog/2016/03/5-things-your-hvac-tech-does-during-an-hvac-checkup

Title: 41811 -  # Signs Your Air Conditioning is About to Break
Direction: 500 words. List 3-6 signs that an HVAC system is about to break. Try to avoid the obvious like "It's not blowing cold air," and touch on other issues like water where there shouldn't be, new odors, and strange noises. To incorporate the client link, mention that calling an HVAC repair team early on can save you instead of calling when your AC does break (and it will keep everyone more comfortable). The resource links provide plenty of ideas to discuss. Your target audience is moms. Please link to this blog post as your target URL, not the client’s homepage: http://www.senicaair.com/article/shouldnt-even-think-diy-ing-hvac-repair
